ui.treemap.viz.control
Class MyWheelNaviControl

java.lang.Object
  prefuse.controls.ControlAdapter
      ui.treemap.viz.control.MyWheelNaviControl
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyListener, MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, MouseWheelListener, EventListener, prefuse.controls.Control
public class MyWheelNaviControl
extends prefuse.controls.ControlAdapter

Author:
kevin nam Mouse wheel control for moving up and down the tree depth. In a TreeMap, only the leaf nodes are selectable and clickable, and you can't select a parent node. This control allows a user to select the parent node of a node by scrolling the mousewheel. Scrolling up selects the parent, scrolling down from the parent selects the child. Since it's not very obvious this feature exists in the viz, some indication may be needed.
